summary: This bill, the Ensuring Casualty Assistance for our Firefighters Act (H.R. 4671), directs the Secretary of the Interior to develop a Wildland Fire Management Casualty Assistance Program. The program aims to provide assistance to the next-of-kin of firefighters and wildland fire support personnel who are critically injured, become ill, or are killed in the line of duty. The program will address notification procedures, reimbursement for travel expenses, assignment, training, duties, supervision, accountability, and case management of casualty assistance officers, as well as providing information on available benefits and complaints process. The bill also defines 'next-of-kin'.
